sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The eXist-db Quick Start document contains basic instructions for installing eXist. This article explains more advanced methods of installing and running eXist.

sect1.title: Headless Installation
sect1.para: The eXist-db installer requires a graphical desktop in order to launch. However, If you wish to install eXist-db on a headless system, use the -console parameter when launching the installer from the command line. For example:

sect1.title: Running eXist-db as a Service
sect1.para: Instead of manually running the eXist-db server in a shell window, you may prefer to run it as a background service which is automatically launched during system startup. This can be convenient, because eXist-db can continue to run even after users have logged off of the system.
eXist-db comes with pre-configured scripts that use YAJSW (Yet Another Java Service Wrapper) to handle the setup procedure. The required scripts are contained in the directory tools/yajsw.

sect2.title: Windows
sect2.para: On Windows, you can simply choose the option to Install eXist-db as Service from the eXist-db menu created in the start menu. You can also call tools/yajsw/bin/installService.bat instead. This will install eXist-db and Jetty as a Windows service.

note.para: Installing eXist-db as a service on Windows Vista requires full administrator rights. Right click on the start menu item and select "Run as administrator". You may need to do this even if you are already logged in as an administrator.

sect1.title: About the Scripts in the bin Directory
sect1.para: Included in the distribution are a number of useful .sh (Unix Shell) and .bat (DOS batch) programs located in the bin directory. Whether you have installed the source distribution or used the installer, you can find this directory in the root directory of the installation.
If you find that the programs do not launch, you can also manually launch these files on the command-line, and specify which application you would like to start.

listitem.para: Description: Starts the included Jetty web server at port 8080. eXist is installed as a web application, located at http://localhost:8080/exist/.

Description: Closes the running instance of eXist. If eXist has been started with startup.sh, calling shutdown.sh will also stop the Jetty web server. Otherwise, only the database is stopped by this call, since eXist has no control over the environment in which it is running. You should always call shutdown before killing the server process.
Description: Launches eXist as a stand-alone server process. In this setup, eXist is only accessible through the XMLRPC and the simple, built-in HTTP interface.
